title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Boil the pasta in salted water until al dente.
Fry the pancetta until crispy.
Beat the eggs in a bowl, then mix in the cheese and pepper.
Drain the pasta, then toss with pancetta and remove from heat.
Quickly mix in the egg and cheese mixture, stirring until creamy.
Serve with extra cheese and pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato-based gravy.
instructions: Marinate the chicken in yogurt and tikka masala paste for 2 hours.
Grill the chicken until cooked through.
Fry the onions, garlic, and spices in a pan until fragrant.
Add the tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in the cream and add the grilled chicken.
Simmer for another 10 minutes and serve.

title: Beef Stroganoff
summary: Russian dish made with sautéed beef in a sour cream-based sauce.
instructions: Slice the beef into strips and season with salt and pepper.
Fry the onions and mushrooms in butter until soft.
Add the beef and cook until browned.
Stir in the sour cream, mustard, and paprika.
Simmer for 10 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Serve with rice or noodles.

title: Margherita Pizza
summary: Classic pizza topped with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, basil, and olive oil.
instructions: Preheat oven to 250°C.
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella.
Top the dough with tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden and crispy.

title: Pad Thai
summary: A popular Thai street food made with stir-fried rice noodles, shrimp, peanuts, egg, and bean sprouts.
ingredients: Pad Thai sauce (tamarind, fish sauce, sugar)
instructions: Soak the rice noodles in warm water until soft.
Fry the shrimp until cooked and set aside.
Scramble the eggs in the same pan.
Add the noodles and Pad Thai sauce, and stir-fry.
Toss in the shrimp, bean sprouts, and peanuts.
Serve with lime wedges.

title: Caesar Salad
summary: A fresh salad with romaine lettuce, croutons, parmesan, and a zesty Caesar dressing.
instructions: Wash and chop the lettuce.
Mix the garlic, mayonnaise, lemon juice, mustard, and anchovies to make the dressing.
Toss the lettuce with croutons and parmesan.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve.

title: Shakshuka
summary: A North African and Middle Eastern dish of poached eggs in a spicy tomato sauce.
instructions: Sauté the onions, garlic, and bell pepper until soft.
Add the tomatoes, cumin, and paprika, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Make wells in the sauce and crack the eggs into them.
Cover and cook until the eggs are set.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

title: Tacos al Pastor
summary: Mexican tacos with marinated pork, pineapple, and fresh cilantro.
instructions: Marinate the pork in achiote paste for 2 hours.
Grill the pork and pineapple until charred.
Slice the pork and pineapple thinly.
Warm the tortillas and fill them with the pork and pineapple.
Top with fresh cilantro and serve with lime wedges.

title: Sushi Rolls
summary: Traditional Japanese rolls made with seasoned rice, seaweed, and fresh fish or vegetables.
instructions: Rinse and cook the sushi rice, then season with rice vinegar.
Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo mat and spread the rice evenly.
Place slices of fish, cucumber, and avocado in the center.
Roll the sushi tightly and slice into pieces.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

title: Eggplant Parmesan
summary: Layers of breaded eggplant slices, marinara sauce, and mozzarella cheese baked to perfection.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Slice the eggplants and season with salt. Let them sit for 30 minutes to remove moisture.
Coat the eggplant slices in breadcrumbs and fry until golden.
In a baking dish, layer the fried eggplant, marinara sauce, mozzarella, and parmesan.
Repeat the layers and finish with cheese on top.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Garnish with fresh basil and serve.
